intro: Cynoglossum fiebrigii, commonly known as the feverfew plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Cynoglossum fiebrigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine.
